tool.name: Scater normalise
tool.description: Normalise from serialized scater R object
tool.command:
ln -s '$R_scater_qc' R_scater_qc.rds;
scater-normalize.R -i '$R_scater_qc' #if $exprs_value: --exprs-values '$exprs_value' #end if #if $return_log: --return-log '$return_log' #end if #if $log_exprs_offset: --log-exprs-offset '$log_exprs_offset' #end if #if $centre_size_factors: --centre-size-factors '$centre_size_factors' #end if #if $return_norm_as_exprs: --return-norm-as-exprs '$return_norm_as_exprs' #end if -o '$R_scater_normalize'

param.name: R_scater_qc
param.help: File name in which a serialized R SingleCellExperiment object where object matrix found

param.name: exprs_value
param.label: expression counts values from RDS object
param.help: character string indicating which slot of the assayData from the ‘SingleCellExperiment’ object should be used to compute log-transformed expression values. Valid options are ‘'counts'’, ‘'tpm'’, ‘'cpm'’ and ‘'fpkm'’. Defaults to the first available value of the options in the order shown.

param.name: return_log
param.label: should normalized values be returned on the log scale
param.help: logical(1), should normalized values be returned on the log scale? Default is ‘TRUE’. If ‘TRUE’, output is stored as 'logcounts' in the returned object; if ‘FALSE’ output is stored as 'normcounts'.

param.name: log_exprs_offset
param.label: should size factors centred at unity be stored in the returned object
param.help: scalar numeric value giving the offset to add when taking log2 of normalised values to return as expression values. If NULL, value is taken from metadata(object)$log.exprs.offset if defined, otherwise 1.

param.name: centre_size_factors
param.label: centre size factors
param.help: logical, should size factors centred at unity be stored in the returned object if ‘exprs_values='counts'? Defaults to TRUE. Regardless, centred size factors will always be used to calculate 'exprs' from count data. This argument is ignored for other ‘exprs_values’, where no size factors are used/modified.

param.name: return_norm_as_exprs
param.label: return norm as exprs
param.help: logical, should the normalised expression values be returned to the 'exprs' slot of the object? Default is TRUE. If FALSE, values in the 'exprs' slot will be left untouched. Regardless, normalised expression values will be returned in the 'norm_exprs(object)'' slot.'.

data.name: R_scater_normalize
data.help: File name in which to store serialized R object of type 'SingleCellExperiment.

tool.help:
Usage: scater-normalize.R [options]
Options: -i INPUT-OBJECT-FILE, --input-object-file=INPUT-OBJECT-FILE
-e EXPRS-VALUES, --exprs-values=EXPRS-VALUES
-l RETURN-LOG, --return-log=RETURN-LOG
-f LOG-EXPRS-OFFSET, --log-exprs-offset=LOG-EXPRS-OFFSET
-c CENTRE-SIZE-FACTORS, --centre-size-factors=CENTRE-SIZE-FACTORS
-r RETURN-NORM-AS-EXPRS, --return-norm-as-exprs=RETURN-NORM-AS-EXPRS
-o OUTPUT-OBJECT-FILE, --output-object-file=OUTPUT-OBJECT-FILE
-h, --help Show this help message and exit
